com.raweng.built

Class BuiltGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltGroup

  • public class BuiltGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    A Group is special type of field in Built.io Backend. The reason its named such is that its a set of fields grouped together. Each group field has its own schema and can contain sub-groups.
    Author:
    built.io. Inc

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BuiltGroup()
      Create BuiltGroup instance without field uid for adding in multiple true group.
      BuiltGroup(java.lang.String fieldUid)
      Create BuiltGroup instance.

      • BuiltGroup

        public BuiltGroup()
        Create BuiltGroup instance without field uid for adding in multiple true group.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup steps = new BuiltGroup();

      • BuiltGroup

        public BuiltGroup(java.lang.String fieldUid)
        Create BuiltGroup instance.
        Parameters:
        fieldUid - field uid of group.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup details = new BuiltGroup("details");

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public BuiltGroup set(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> keyValueObject)
        Use this method to add a new key value pair in group.
        Parameters:
        keyValueObject - HashMap object.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup details = new BuiltGroup("details");
        
  HashMap<String, Object> hash = new HashMap<String, Object>();
  hash.put("name", "Super Project #41!");
  hash.put("description", "This is a very cool project");
        
  details.set(hash);

        value - value of a specified field.

        Example :
         BuiltGroup group = new BuiltGroup("details");
        
 details.set("name", "Super Project #41!");

      • addGroup

        public BuiltGroup addGroup(BuiltGroup builtGroup)
        Use this method to add a BuiltGroup in group.
        Parameters:
        builtGroup - BuiltGroup instance.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup group = new BuiltGroup("details");
        
  BuiltGroup group1 = new BuiltGroup("inside_group_field_uid");
        
  group.addGroup(group1);

        public BuiltGroup addGroupMultiple(BuiltGroupMultiple builtGroupMultiple)

        Example :
          BuiltGroup group = new BuiltGroup("group_field_uid");
        

  BuiltGroupMultiple multiGroup= new BuiltGroupMultiple("multiple_inside_group_field_uid");
        
  group.addGroupMultiple(multiGroup);

      • setReference

        public BuiltGroup setReference(java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String value)
        This method is similar to setReference and should only be used if the reference field is a part of group field
        Parameters:
        key - field.
        value - value can be uid string of a referenced object.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
  pm.set("name", "John");
  pm.setReference("departments", "blt124sample2122l");

      • setReference

        public BuiltGroup setReference(java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String[] value)
        Assigns a set references to a reference field of an object
        Parameters:
        key - field.
        value - value can be array of field uids of a referenced object.
        Returns:
        BuiltObject object, so you can chain this call.



        Example :

         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 //Assuming 'taskObject' is a BuiltObject instance
 
        
 BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
 pm.set("name", "John");
 pm.setReferences("project", new String[]{"bltb6202sample73a1"});

      • setReferenceWhere

        public BuiltGroup setReferenceWhere(java.lang.String referenceKey,
                                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> value)
        This method is similar to setReferenceWhere and should only be used if the reference field is a part of group field.
        Parameters:
        referenceKey - reference key
        value - HashMap object. Contains referred class field uid and its respective value. reference set on object where all key value pairs of HashMap matches.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
  pm.set("name", "John");

  HashMap<String, Object> conditionHash = new HashMap<String, Object>();
  conditionHash.put("department_type", "type1");

  pm.setReferenceWhere("departments", conditionHash);

      • setReferenceWithObject

        public BuiltGroup setReferenceWithObject(java.lang.String key,
                                         BuiltObject value)
        To set BuiltObject for a specified reference field.
        Parameters:
        key - field.
        value - value can be BuiltObject instance.

        Example :
          BuiltObject departmentA = department.object();
  departmentA.set("name", "Department A");

  BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
  pm.set("name", "John");
  pm.setReferenceWithObject("departments", departmentA);

      • setReferenceWithObject

        public BuiltGroup setReferenceWithObject(java.lang.String key,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<BuiltObject> value)
        To set array of BuiltObject for a specified reference field.
        Parameters:
        key - field.
        value - value can be array of BuiltObject.

        Example :
          BuiltObject departmentA = department.object();
  departmentA.set("name", "Department A");

  BuiltObject departmentB = department.object();
  departmentB.set("name", "Department B");

  ArrayList<BuiltObject> departmentList = new ArrayList<BuiltObject>();
  departmentList.add(departmentA);
  departmentList.add(departmentB);

  BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
  pm.set("name", "John");
  pm.setReferencesWithObject("departments", departmentList);

      • upsertForReference

        public BuiltGroup upsertForReference(java.lang.String key,
                                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> conditionFieldValues,
                                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> newFieldValues)
        Use this method only when the values of the fields inside the referenced object are to be changed while creating a new object
        Parameters:
        key - field uid.
        conditionFieldValues - HashMap object containing key value pairs for search condition.
        newFieldValues - HashMap object containing key value pairs for the fields inside the referenced object.

        Example :
          HashMap<String, Object> condition = new HashMap<String, Object>();
  condition.put("name", "Department A1");

  HashMap<String, Object> replacement = new HashMap<String, Object>();
  replacement.put("name", "Department A");
  replacement.put("department_type", "type1");

  BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
  pm.set("name", "John");

  pm.upsertForReference("departments", condition, replacement);

      • upsertForReferences

        public BuiltGroup upsertForReferences(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> conditionFieldValues,
                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> newFieldValues)
        Use this method only when the values of the fields inside the referenced object are to be changed while creating a new object
        Parameters:
        key - field uid.
        conditionFieldValues - HashMap object containing key value pairs for search condition.
        newFieldValues - HashMap object containing key value pairs for the fields inside the referenced object.

        Example :
          HashMap<String, Object> condition = new HashMap<String, Object>();
  condition.put("name", "Department A1");

  HashMap<String, Object> replacement = new HashMap<String, Object>();
  replacement.put("name", "Department A");
  replacement.put("department_type", "type1");

  BuiltGroup pm = new BuiltGroup("project_manager");
  pm.set("name", "John");

  pm.upsertForReferences("departments", condition, replacement);

      • pushValue

        public BuiltGroup pushValue(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Appends a value in the given field (Applies only to fields that allow multiple values)
        Parameters:
        key - field uid.
        value - value to enter in field.
        Returns:
        BuiltObject object, so you can chain this call.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup group = new BuiltGroup("group_field_uid");
        
  group.pushValue("key", "value");

      • pullValue

        public BuiltGroup pullValue(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        For the given field, it deletes the first matched value (Applies only to fields that allow multiple values)
        Parameters:
        key - field uid.
        value - field value. Value can be a list of objects or a string value.
        Returns:
        BuiltObject object, so you can chain this call.

        Example :
          BuiltGroup group = new BuiltGroup("group_field_uid");
        
  group.pullValue("key", "value");

      • updateValue

        public void updateValue(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value,
                        int index)
        To update a value in a field that allows multiple values.

        Note :- This function will be used as individual.

        Parameters:
        key - field uid which value want to
        value - field value which want to update
        index - index value.

        Example :
         BuiltGroup group = new BuiltGroup("group_field_uid");
        
 group.updateValue("key", "replaceValue", 1);

      • toJSON

        public org.json.JSONObject toJSON()
        Returns JSON representation of group data.

        Example :
             JSONObject json = group.toJSON();
